plugins.name: Pexels Stock Photos
plugins.description:
üåü Transform Your Designs with Pexels Stock Photo Plugin for Figma!


Unlock an endless library of high-quality stock photos right within your Figma workspace. üé® Whether you're a designer, marketer, or content creator, our plugin makes it easy to elevate your projects with stunning visuals.

Key Features:


Instant Access: Browse and insert thousands of free stock photos from Pexels without leaving Figma. üì∏

User-Friendly Interface: Enjoy a seamless experience with an intuitive layout that simplifies your workflow. üñ±Ô∏è

Diverse Categories: Find the perfect image for any theme‚Äîbe it nature, technology, or lifestyle! üåç


Why Choose Pexels Stock Photo?


Enhance Creativity: Fuel your design process with beautiful imagery that inspires. ‚ú®

Save Time: No more searching multiple sites‚Äîget all your stock photos in one place! ‚è±Ô∏è

Free to Use: Access high-quality photos without any cost, making your projects budget-friendly. üí∞


Elevate your designs effortlessly with the Pexels Stock Photo plugin for Figma‚Äîyour go-to tool for stunning visuals!

plugins.name: Font Replacer
plugins.description:
Instantly view all fonts used in your selection, selectively replace specific font families, and preserve font weights and styles when switching to new fonts. Whether you're cleaning up inconsistent typography, updating your brand, or exploring new typefaces, Font Replacer makes the process fast, intuitive, and reliable.


  1. See all fonts in your selection at a glance
  2. Replace one or multiple font families with a single click
  3. Maintains font weights/styles (e.g., Bold, Italic) when switching families
  4. Handles mixed-font text layers and nested groups
  5. Smart fallbacks ensure your text always looks great
  6. Clean, modern UI with loading indicators for large selections
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly swap and manage fonts in your Figma designs

plugins.name: Pseudo Localizer for Figma & FigJam
plugins.description:
Design global-ready UIs‚Äîwithout ever leaving Figma.


Skip the guesswork and see how your designs hold up in other languages, scripts, and text directions‚Äîinstantly. With Pseudo Localizer, you can preview localized versions of your UI in seconds, directly inside Figma or FigJam. No setup, no logins, no external tools. Just you and your design.


‚ÑπÔ∏è What you can do with Pseudo Localizer:


‚úÖ Preview global scripts instantly

Toggle between Latin, Cyrillic, CJK, and Arabic (RTL) with a single click.


‚úÖ Test layout resilience

Stretch or shrink text length from ‚Äì50% to +50% to spot issues like clipping, wrapping, or misalignment.


‚úÖ Control the scope

Run it on a single button, a card, or the whole page‚Äîyour call.


‚úÖ Keep it private & fast

Everything happens on your machine. No accounts, no external servers, no privacy worries.


‚ùóÔ∏èWhy it matters:


  1. Catch layout issues before they become bugs.
  2. Give your QA and localization teams better previews.
  3. Design smarter for a global audience‚Äîright from the start.


‚öôÔ∏è How it works:


  1. Select your screens with text layers (or don't select anything to pseudo translate the full page).
  2. Pick your script and text expansion.
  3. Click "Pseudotranslate"‚Äîdone! A new page appears with your mocked-up, localized content (including RTL adjustments).


‚ú® Ready to build for every language?

Install Pseudo Localizer from the Figma Community and see how your designs hold up across the globe.


üì® Got feedback? Share it here!

accepted.name: Jos√© J√≥vena Casa√±
accepted.description:
Helping teams make great design work everywhere.
Big on UX, localization, and making things clear across cultures.
Rookie Figma Plugin Author.

plugins.tagline: Instantly pseudotranslate your Figma designs to test global layouts‚Äîno setup, no accounts.

plugins.name: Legoify
plugins.description:
Turn any image or frame into stunning BLOCK-style artwork with just one click. Legoify automatically generates a perfect grid of glassmorphic BLOCK bricks that overlay your design, creating that iconic brick aesthetic instantly. Perfect for mockups, presentations, or adding a playful dimension to your projects. Unleash your inner brick artist without the tedious manual work.


Features:


  1. One-click LEGO transformation
  2. Auto-adapts to any image size
  3. Realistic brick detail with studs
  4. Glassmorphic effect for modern appeal
  5. Non-destructive editing (original preserved)


From photos to UI designs‚Äîif you can select it, you can Legoify it!
plugins.tagline: One click brick or block effect generator

plugins.name: Syntax Highlighter
plugins.description:
How to use


Applying syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a code snippet.
  2. Choose a programming language, if required (the plugin will try to identify the language automatically).
  3. Choose a theme.
  4. Toggle include background and line numbers, if required.
  5. Click Apply.


Clearing syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a formatted code snippet.
  2. Click the Clear formatting button.


Adding custom Visual Studio themes


  1. Open Visual Studio Code.
  2. Install the desired color theme and switch to the theme in Visual Studio Code.
  3. Press Ctrl + Shift + P and run Developer: Generate Color Theme from current settings.
  4. Select the file's contents and copy.
  5. Open the Figma plugin and press the Create a new theme button.
  6. Paste into the Create a new theme dialog and click Save.


Note: This plugin supports up to 10 custom themes.

accepted.name: Microsoft
accepted.description: The official account for Microsoft Design.

plugins.tagline: Apply syntax highlighting colors to code snippets.

plugins.name: Text & Color to CSS Variables
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you generate clean, reusable CSS variables from selected Figma layers.

It supports both text styles and fill colors, and automatically converts them into:


@mixin snippets for font styles


:root CSS variables for color values (in HEX format)


Auto-detects color types like color-gray, color-blue, color-red, etc.


Prevents name duplication with numbered suffixes (e.g., --color-gray-1, --color-gray-2)


Sorts all variables in ascending order for better readability


Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
plugins.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

131055.name: Text & Color to CSS Variables
131055.description:
This plugin helps you generate clean, reusable CSS variables from selected Figma layers.

It supports both text styles and fill colors, and automatically converts them into:


@mixin snippets for font styles


:root CSS variables for color values (in HEX format)


Auto-detects color types like color-gray, color-blue, color-red, etc.


Prevents name duplication with numbered suffixes (e.g., --color-gray-1, --color-gray-2)


Sorts all variables in ascending order for better readability


Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
131055.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

plugins.name: Easy Task Prioritiser
plugins.description:
Easy Task Prioritiser‚Ä®Quickly organize and rank your tasks using two proven prioritization frameworks ‚Äî right inside Figma.


‚ú® How It Works

üî¢ Stack Ranking

Go to the Stack tab.

Enter your list of tasks.

Click Start Comparison to begin.

You‚Äôll be shown two tasks at a time ‚Äî choose which is more important.

Repeat until all tasks are compared and ranked.

In the end:

You'll get a clear, ranked list of tasks

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to bring the list into your Figma file


üß† MoSCoW Prioritization

Switch to the MoSCoW tab.

Add your tasks.

For each task, select whether it‚Äôs a Must, Should, Could, or Won‚Äôt.

Once done, use Push to Canvas to generate a structured visual layout by category.

In the end:

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to see tasks grouped by priority


This plugin is perfect for product teams, designers, and facilitators who want to make prioritization decisions quickly ‚Äî and stay focused on what matters most.
plugins.tagline: Turn messy task lists into clear priorities.

plugins.name: FileDetox
plugins.description: FileDetox is a powerful Figma cleanup tool that hunts down and eliminates the hidden clutter slowing down your design files. With its distinctive neo-brutalist interface, FileDetox quickly identifies hidden layers, empty frames, unused styles, and off-canvas elements that contribute to file bloat. In just a few clicks, purge unnecessary elements and optimize your workflow. Design with intention, not with digital baggage. Made by gautham.

plugins.name: Find & Replace Anything
plugins.description:
Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!


A powerful tool for finding and replacing styles! Works with components, instances and library styles. Especially helpful to align parameters across projects in bulk like auto layout or library styles for your pixel perfect design.


Plugin is in active development. Therefore, any feedback is appreciated! Like our plugin? Leave a heart!


Full feature list:


Library & local Styles

  1. Fonts
  2. Colors
  3. Effects
  4. Grids


Variables (search only)

  1. Color Variable
  2. Number Variable
  3. String Variable
  4. Boolean Variable


Shape & Frame

  1. Name
  2. Width
  3. Height
  4. Position X
  5. Position Y
  6. Rotation
  7. Constrain Proportions
  8. Clip content


Text

  1. Text
  2. Font Size
  3. Paragraphs Spacing
  4. Paragraph Indent
  5. Text Decoration
  6. Text Case
  7. Text Resizing
  8. Text Align Horizontal
  9. Text Align Vertical


Layer

  1. Blend Mode
  2. Opacity
  3. Visibility


Stroke

  1. Stroke Align
  2. Stroke Weight
  3. Stroke Join


Auto Layout

  1. Layout mode
  2. Spacing between items
  3. Paddings
plugins.tagline: Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!

plugins.name: Mode Match
plugins.description:
Mode Match lets you take a variable's value from one mode and apply it to other modes. Match a single variable, group of variables, or all variables in a collection!


  1. Select your multi-mode collection
  2. Select the source mode (copy from)
  3. Select the destination mode (copy to)
  4. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  5. Update ‚ú®


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering a path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input


Plugin Notes

  1. Collection list will only show collections with more than 1 mode
  2. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  3. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Supports

  1. All variable types (number, string, boolean, color)
  2. Aliasing
  3. Raw values


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer ‚Ä¢ Plugin Author ‚Ä¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Match variable values across modes.

131968.name: Mode Match
131968.description:
Mode Match lets you take a variable's value from one mode and apply it to other modes. Match a single variable, group of variables, or all variables in a collection!


  1. Select your multi-mode collection
  2. Select the source mode (copy from)
  3. Select the destination mode (copy to)
  4. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  5. Update ‚ú®


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering a path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input


Plugin Notes

  1. Collection list will only show collections with more than 1 mode
  2. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  3. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Supports

  1. All variable types (number, string, boolean, color)
  2. Aliasing
  3. Raw values


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

plugins.name: Find Duplicates
plugins.description: Effortlessly manage your Figma layers with this plugin that scans the root-level children of a selected node and identifies duplicates by name. plugins.name: MoveQuack
plugins.description:
Feature Overview

This plugin allows users to set customizable timers for both work and break periods, catering to individual needs.


Key Features

Customizable Timer: Set specific times for work and rest, with full flexibility.

Timed Reminders: Automatically alerts users when it's time to take a break, preventing overwork.

Boost Efficiency and Health: Helps maintain high productivity while ensuring overall well-being.


Use Cases

Perfect for users who engage in long work or study sessions, especially for professionals like designers and developers who need regular breaks.
plugins.tagline: Break Reminder Timer

plugins.name: Synchronize Frames
plugins.description:
This program enhances efficiency in Figma by allowing users to synchronize frames automatically. It ensures that any modifications made to a selected frame are instantly reflected in all corresponding frames, promoting consistency across designs. The user interface features intuitive buttons to assign frames, toggle synchronization, and activate auto-sync capabilities.


To automatically search for frames for synchronization, the "SS_" tag must be specified before the frame name.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly synchronize your design frames for a more efficient workflow

113339.name: Synchronize Frames

It ensures that any modifications made to a selected frame are instantly reflected in all corresponding frames, promoting consistency across designs. To automatically search for frames for synchronization, the "SS_" tag must be specified before the frame name.

plugins.name: snapInsert
plugins.description:
snapInsert is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of searching filtering and adding component instances into your designs.

Perfect for designers and teams who work with large design systems, Component Filter helps you save time and maintain focus on your design tasks.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Component Set Filtering: Easily filter components by their set names to focus on specific groups within your design system.

‚Ä¢ Dynamic Key-Value Filtering: Use key-value pairs to narrow down your search and find exactly what you need based on component properties like size, orientation, or any custom attributes.

‚Ä¢ Real-Time Results: As you apply filters, see immediate updates to the component list, ensuring you always have the most relevant components in view.

‚Ä¢ Intuitive UI: The plugin features a clean, user-friendly interface that integrates seamlessly with Figma, making it easy to apply filters and manage your components.


Note:

Currently, Component Filter only searches for components within the file you are working on. In future releases, users will be able to search components from published design libraries, expanding the plugin's functionality to cover broader design systems.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly search and insert component instances from sets or singles into your designs.

102736.name: snapInsert
102736.description:

‚Ä¢ Dynamic Key-Value Filtering: Use key-value pairs to narrow down your search and find exactly what you need based on component properties like size, orientation, or any custom attributes.

‚Ä¢ Real-Time Results: As you apply filters, see immediate updates to the component list, ensuring you always have the most relevant components in view.

‚Ä¢ Intuitive UI: The plugin features a clean, user-friendly interface that integrates seamlessly with Figma, making it easy to apply filters and manage your components.


Note:

Currently, Component Filter only searches for components within the file you are working on. In future releases, users will be able to search components from published design libraries, expanding the plugin's functionality to cover broader design systems.
102736.tagline: Effortlessly search and insert component instances from sets or singles into your designs.

plugins.name: Liquid Glass
plugins.description:
Liquid Glass creates high-fidelity, scalable glass effects for modern UI designs. Transform any component with sophisticated multi-layered glass effects that automatically scale to fit your design.


‚ú® Features:

- Light Mode and Dark Mode themes to match any design system

- Create pre-configured glass components or apply effects to existing designs

- Preserves original colors with adjustable opacity (optional)


Perfect for creating modern, elegant interfaces with depth and dimension. Whether you're designing tab bars, buttons, cards or custom components, Liquid Glass delivers Apple-inspired glass effects with just a few clicks.


Based on Apple's WWDC25 design language, this plugin brings the latest UI trends to your Figma workflow.
plugins.tagline: Create stunning, scalable glass effects inspired by Apple's modern UI design

plugins.name: Corners Alignment
plugins.description:
‰∏ªË¶ÅÂäüËÉΩ


1. ÂØπÈΩêÂ§ö‰∏™ÈÄâÂÆöÁü©ÂΩ¢ÁöÑÁõ∏ÂØπÂúÜËßí

ÂΩìÊÇ®ÈÄâ‰∏≠‰∏§‰∏™ÊàñÂ§ö‰∏™Áü©ÂΩ¢ (Rectangle) Êó∂ÔºåÊèí‰ª∂‰ºöÔºö

Ëá™Âä®ËØÜÂà´ÈÄâÂå∫‰∏≠Â∞∫ÂØ∏ÊúÄÂ§ßÁöÑÁü©ÂΩ¢‰Ωú‰∏∫‚ÄúÂ§ñÈÉ®ÂèÇËÄÉÁü©ÂΩ¢‚Äù„ÄÇ

Ë∞ÉÊï¥ÂÖ∂‰ªñËæÉÂ∞èÁü©ÂΩ¢ÁöÑÂúÜËßíÔºå‰ΩøÂÖ∂ÂúÜËßíÂºßÂ∫¶‰∏éÊúÄÂ§ßÁü©ÂΩ¢ÁöÑÂúÜËßíÂºßÂ∫¶Âú®ËßÜËßâ‰∏ä‰øùÊåÅ‰∏éÂÆÉ‰ª¨‰πãÈó¥ËæπË∑ùÁõ∏Á≠âÁöÑÁ©∫Èó¥ÊÑü„ÄÇ

Â¶ÇÊûúÁü©ÂΩ¢‰∏çÊòØÊåâÊØî‰æãÂ±Ö‰∏≠ÂØπÈΩêÔºåÂàô‰ºö‰ΩøÁî®ÂÆÉ‰ª¨‰πãÈó¥ÁöÑÊúÄÂ∞èËæπË∑ù‰Ωú‰∏∫ËÆ°ÁÆó‰æùÊçÆ„ÄÇ


2. ÂØπÈΩêÂÆπÂô®ÂÜÖÂÖÉÁ¥†ÁöÑÂúÜËßíÔºàÈÄâ‰∏≠ÂÆπÂô®Êó∂Ôºâ

ÂΩìÊÇ®ÈÄâ‰∏≠‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁîªÊ°Ü (Frame) ÊàñÂêØÁî®‰∫ÜËá™Âä®Â∏ÉÂ±Ä (Auto Layout)„ÄÅÁªÑ‰ª∂ (Component) ÊàñÂÆû‰æã (Instance) Êó∂ÔºåÊèí‰ª∂‰ºöÔºö

Â∞ÜÂÖ∂ËßÜ‰∏∫‚ÄúÂ§ñÈÉ®ÂÆπÂô®‚Äù„ÄÇ

Ë∞ÉÊï¥ËØ•ÂÆπÂô®ÂÜÖÈÉ®ÊâÄÊúâÁ¨¶ÂêàÊù°‰ª∂ÁöÑ„ÄêÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÂ±Ç„ÄëÂ≠êÂÖÉÁ¥†ÔºàÂ¶ÇÁü©ÂΩ¢„ÄÅÂÖ∂‰ªñÁîªÊ°ÜÁ≠âÔºâÁöÑÂúÜËßí„ÄÇ


Main Features


1. Aligning the Relative Corner Radii of Multiple Selected Rectangles

When you select two or more rectangles (Rectangle), the plugin will:

- Automatically identify the largest rectangle in the selection as the "outer reference rectangle."

- Adjust the corner radii of the smaller rectangles so that their curvature visually maintains a sense of spacing equal to the margins between them and the largest rectangle.

- If the rectangles are not proportionally center-aligned, the smallest margin between them will be used as the basis for calculation.


2. Aligning the Corner Radii of Elements Within a Container (When Selecting a Container)

When you select a frame (Frame), or an auto-layout-enabled component (Component) or instance (Instance), the plugin will:

- Treat it as an "outer container."

- Adjust the corner radii of all eligible **first-level** child elements (such as rectangles, other frames, etc.) inside the container.
plugins.tagline: ÂØπÈΩêÂµåÂ•óÂúÜËßí Align nested corners

Â∞ÜÂÖ∂ËßÜ‰∏∫‚ÄúÂ§ñÈÉ®ÂÆπÂô®‚Äù„ÄÇ

Main Features

It's built for freelancers and creatives working with German public-sector clients who need to submit invoices via portals like ZRE, OZG-RE, or PEPPOL. plugins.name: WCAG Contrast Auditor
plugins.description:
WCAG Contrast Auditor is a Figma plugin that helps you guarantee your text meets WCAG accessibility standards‚Äîno manual math or guesswork required. Simply:


  1. Select the text layers you want to check (or select a parent frame to audit everything inside).
  2. Pick your background color and target WCAG level (AA or AAA).
  3. Run Audit to instantly see how many layers pass or fail the chosen contrast threshold.


Key benefits:

  1. Automated compliance checks: Scan dozens or hundreds of text layers in seconds.
  2. Flexible thresholds: Choose between WCAG AA (4.5:1) or AAA (7:1) contrast ratios.
  3. Lightweight & zero setup: No external dependencies‚Äîjust install and go.
  4. Actionable results: Get a quick pass/fail count so you know exactly where to focus your fixes.


Whether you‚Äôre building design systems, client deliverables, or internal UIs, WCAG Contrast Auditor makes accessibility a seamless, one-click step in your workflow. Ensure every color combination is compliant‚Äîand ship more inclusive products today!
plugins.tagline: Spot & Fix WCAG Contrast Issues Instantly.

132763.name: WCAG Contrast Auditor
132763.description:

  3. Run Audit to instantly see how many layers pass or fail the chosen contrast threshold.

  2. Flexible thresholds: Choose between WCAG AA (4.5:1) or AAA (7:1) contrast ratios.

Whether you‚Äôre building design systems, client deliverables, or internal UIs, WCAG Contrast Auditor makes accessibility a seamless, one-click step in your workflow. Ensure every color combination is compliant‚Äîand ship more inclusive products today!

plugins.name: STAR Method for Figma
plugins.description:
STAR Method for Figma

Struggling to explain your design process in interviews? The STAR Method for Figma helps you:


Features:

‚ú® Structure case studies with {Situation - Task - Action - Result},

‚ú® Link stories directly to your Figma frames,

‚ú® Practice answering behavioral questions,

‚ú® Export snippets for portfolios & interviews.


How to use:

1. Open any Figma project

2. Fill in STAR sections

3. Copy your interview-ready story!


Open it in your Case Study to try Now!
plugins.tagline: Transform your designs into interview-winning stories.

plugins.name: Detach Aliases
plugins.description:
Detach Aliases lets you resolve variable's aliased values from their sources. Easily detach a specific group of variables or all variables in a collection. You can target one mode at a time or all modes at once!


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  4. Detach


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering the path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input
  3. You will see all variables which are located in the path and would have aliases detached in the preview panel on the left


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  2. Detaching variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer ‚Ä¢ Plugin Author ‚Ä¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Break your collection aliases en masse!
